result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis J. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #16CF34 the Court sentences Mr. Thomas to 1 year and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  

This sentence is consecutive to all sentences in Case #16CF278.

The Court STAYS these prison sentences and places Mr. Thomas on Probation for three years.

The Court reads in an uncharged referral for Criminal Damage to Property (DA Case #16JE539) on the date of violation of 01/27/16 and thereafter bars further prosecution of that referral.

records.addlTxt: with elements
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #16CF34, #16CT278, #16CF280 called at 2:20pm. 
Defendant Dennis J. Thomas in court, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest " entered on Case #16CF34-Count #1, on Case #16CF278-Counts #1, #3 & #6; factual basis stipulated including as to the Domestic Abuse Repeater status ; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall submits a victim impact statement); the Court accepts the pleas, finds  Mr. Thomas guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CF278-Counts #2, #4 & #5 and also Case #16CF280 .  Further, the Court reads in an uncharged referral for Criminal Damage to Property (DA Case #16JE539) on the date of violation of 01/27/16 and thereafter bars further prosecution of that referral.
 
On Case #16CF278-Count #6  the Court sentences Mr. Thomas to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is consecutive to Case #16CF278-Counts #1 & #3
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

On Case #16CF34 the Court sentences Mr. Thomas to  1 year and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  
This sentence is consecutive to all sentences in Case #16CF278.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS these prison sentences and places Mr. Thomas on Probation for three years, with conditions:  
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to complete Certified Batterer's Intervention programming
--no contact with Danielle Graves
--no acts of threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutorily required costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharges and including the Domestic Abuse surcharge in Case #16CF34


On Case #16CF278-Count #1 the Court sentences to serve 9 months in Jail with Huber privileges forthwith, concurrent
On Case #16CF278-Count #3 the Court sentences to serve 9 months in Jail with Huber privileges forthwith, concurrent
The Court gives 47 days credit on the 9 month Jail terms in this case.  
The Court orders that the costs on Case #16CF278 Counts #1 & #3 are due forthwith; if not paid, then civil judgments are to be entered 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
recess 2:57pm

-No acts or threats of violence

The Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf]
Defendant Dennis J. Thomas in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
DOB verified. Defendant is on a probation hold so is currently in the Jefferson County Jail.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $250.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Needs to provide an address 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Danielle Graves or his daughters unless he has explicit written permission from his probation agent
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons as defined by statute

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:24 pm
